abstract: Changes to Fourth Street neighborhood of Santa Ana, California, reflect complex tensions in changing heavily Latino community; neighborhood once catered to back-home tastes of recent immigrants, but as second-and-third generation Latinos become more valuable customers, shopkeepers have begun offering more upscale American products to please them.
snippet: Storekeepers and landlords tangle over change in Santa Ana, Calif., where second- and third-generation Latinos are often less interested in buying “goods from back home” that attract newer immigrants.
lead_paragraph: Storekeepers and landlords tangle over change in Santa Ana, Calif., where second- and third-generation Latinos are often less interested in buying “goods from back home” that attract newer immigrants.

headline.main: New Faces and a Contentious Revival
headline.print_headline: Downtown, New Faces and a Contentious Revival
headline.seo: In Santa Ana, New Faces and a Contentious Revival
